column3: Due to server-side hooks, a push might fail in which case the return value of the hg push command might be different from 0 indicating the push failed. See a copy-paste from the command-line:
This push request shows an error message when the push failed instead of silently ignoring the error by checking the return value of running the hg command.
You might consider to check the other usages of the HgCommandResultNotifier#process method to see whether the output can be improved in other parts of the code as well.
The pull request has been merged. Thank you!
HgPusher now considers the return value of the push command to decide¡­
When there is nothing to push, the return value is 1 but that should ¡­
